task.title: Verify that the ME has returned to service

step.cmd: As the tpaadmin user, check the XDR status on both MEs using the following command:

info.p: Output similar to the following should appear:

fig.codeblock:
[root@sps-me1-oame-0 bin]# xdr-status XDR replication status (local site towards remote sites): ------------------------------------------------------- Collection Time: 2018-06-20 12:31:20 -0400 dlog_free_pct: 100% xdr_timelag: 0 Destination site name: spssite2: ..dc_state: UP ..sync up state: CURRENT ..dc_timelag: 0 ..dc_ship_latency_avg: 0 ..dc_ship_source_error: 0 ..dc_ship_destination_error: 0 XDR replication status (remote sites toward local site): ------------------------------------------------------- Source site name: spssite2 ..Polling time: 2018-06-20 12:31:20 -0400 ..site service state: IN_SERVICE ..collection time: 2018-06-20 12:31:20 -0400 ..dlog_free_pct: 100 ..dc_state: UP ..sync up state: CURRENT ..dc_timelag: 0 ..dc_ship_latency_avg: 0 ..dc_ship_source_error: 275 ..dc_ship_destination_error: 375
Overall States: --------------- Service State: UP Internal service state: Current Override for OOS-WFR: false Override for OOS-DRR: false

step.cmd: Note the errors in the above output:

info.p: These are normal, as long as they do not increment, the xdr is is operational.

step.cmd: Log into the OAM VIP of the ME as tpaadmin and run the following command:

p.userinput: “twiddle <name of Active IOHO e.g. psceel01-ioho-0> get com.alcatel.tpapps.spr:service=LdapClient CurrentLdapConnectionInfo”

info.p: Verify that the LDAP connections have returned.

step.cmd: In the SM GUI choose Global Configurations→MANAGED ELEMENTS→Managed Elements List to verify that the ME appears as registered on the SM.
